summary: The Deafblind Disabled Americans Table Approximation Act (Deafblind DATA Act) mandates the Bureau of the Census to assess the feasibility of publishing data on individuals with combined hearing and vision loss. The bill requires a report to Congress and, starting in 2026, the annual publication of a table summarizing respondents to the American Community Survey who identify as both deaf and blind. This aims to improve understanding of this population's needs and ensure they receive adequate support.
